meanings.definition: To fix firmly in a surrounding mass
meanings.sent1: The roots of the tree imbeds deep into the soil for stability.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter imbeds the nails securely into the wood.
meanings.sent3: The curious squirrel imbeds its acorns in various hiding spots around the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her love for music imbeds itself in every aspect of her life.
meanings.sent5: The memory of that day imbeds itself in my mind, never to be forgotten.

meanings.sent1: The cozy blanket imbeds the warmth around the sleeping child.
meanings.sent2: The thick fog imbeds the city in a mysterious veil.
meanings.sent3: The cat imbeds itself in the pile of freshly laundered clothes.
meanings.sent4: The feeling of peace imbeds itself in the tranquil garden.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread imbeds itself in the kitchen, inviting all to indulge.
